1.SceneDescription:
Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is on the phone, Chandler and Monica are sitting in
the living room, and Ross is in the kitchen as Rachel enters from her bedroom.

lines.Line:
Oh, Phoebe, are you still on hold? I was supposed to call my Dad back
like two hours ago

Oh, yeah, he clipped on, he said call him as soon as you get a chance,
he’s at Flimby’s

Oh, yeah, that’s the word I use when I can’t remember the real
thing
Okay. Hang up! That’s it! Come on

No! Rachel, that’s what they want me to do. My warranty expires
tomorrow, if I don’t get through, they’re not gonna fix my crappy, broken phone
for free! We cannot let them win! It’s us versus them
Uh, listen I gotta double check for tickets tonight. Who-who got what

I need two. I’m bringing Pete. My boyfriend. I have a boyfriend
now
Two it is. Ross, how about you
Two it is. Ross, how about you
Uh, yeah, I ah, I also need two

Who’s number two? One of the more difficult games sewer workers
play
Uh, no, it’s-it’s just this person
Uh, no, it’s-it’s just this person
Like a date type (looks at Rachel) person

Yeah, kinda. It’s this woman from work. I hope that won’t be too
weird. Will it, Rach

No. No, not at all, not at all. I actually was gonna bring someone
myself, so
Okay. (to Phoebe and Chandler) Did ah, you guys mean you plus one
All right, I’ll see you tonight
All right, I’ll see you tonight
Okay, I need a date! (runs to her bedroom
Oh, hey, you guys are finally gonna get to meet Kate

(to Chandler) And I ah, borrowed some of your cologne. I hope she likes
it

Joey, what are you doing?! It’s never gonna happen, she’s
seeing somebody
Yeah, and I don’t have any cologne
Yeah, and I don’t have any cologne
The green bottle next to the shaving cream
Oh! Worm medicine for the duck
Oh! Worm medicine for the duck

2.SceneDescription: Joey’s Premiere, Rachel is already there with her date, Tommy who's played by Ben Stiller who will be in There's Something About Mary and Meet The Parents, as Ross and his date, Cailin, arrive.

lines.Line:
How are you? (She goes to kiss him on the cheek, but stops because of
the dates and pats him on the shoulder.
So it’s looks like we’re the first ones here
Yeah, looks that way. First ones here! Wooo!
Oh! Tommy, this is Ross. Ross, Tommy
Hey. Oh, I’m sorry, this is Cailin

lines.Character:
(They all try and shake hands at once. They end up criss-crossing they’re arms to
shake each other’s hand, and Ross says
lines.Line:
They all try and shake hands at once. They end up criss-crossing they’re arms to
shake each other’s hand, and Ross says…
Okay, uhh, I think I’m going to run to the ladies room

Okay. (The girls leave.) (to Tommy) So uh, well, this-this is uh, this is
awkward
Well y'know ‘cause Rachel and I used to go out
Oh, I didn’t, I didn’t know that
Oh, I didn’t, I didn’t know that
Oh! Well then this is awkward. So what do you uh

Okay. (sees two people sitting in their seats.) Uh, huh. Excuse me,
I’m sorry, I-I think you may be in our seats
Umm, no, I don’t think so
Umm, no, I don’t think so
Can-can we take a look at your ticket
(looking at ticket) Yep! Yeah, see this says D-13, and uh
Oh, well I thought that ah
Oh, well I thought that ah

Oh, you thought, huh? Yeah, well that didn’t really work out too
well for you did it you idiot!! What are you?! A moron!! Huh?! It says D-13! Okay?!
Look you’re surrounded by even numbers!! Did that give you some clue?
Uh, the usher told us to come
Uh, the usher told us to come

Oh! Oh! The usher must be right! What, with all that training they go
through! Get out!! (They start to leave.) Here! (He throws him back his ticket.) (to Ross,
calmly) Hey man, you want the aisle
No, I’m good. (He sits down, stunned.
No, I’m good. (He sits down, stunned.

3.SceneDescription: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are returning. Phoebe is still on hold.

lines.Line: Thank you for your patience, you’re the next caller
You were the next caller five hours ago. You must be going crazy

lines.Character:
(Both Rachel and Monica walk into their bedrooms, stop, and come back into the living
room with confused looks on their faces
lines.Line:
Both Rachel and Monica walk into their bedrooms, stop, and come back into the living
room with confused looks on their faces.

Oh, okay, yeah. (to Monica) I put your stuff in her room, and her stuff
in your room

4.SceneDescription:
Kate’s Apartment, Joey and Kate are returning from a night out on the
town.

lines.Line: (drunk) So you really think those newspapers are just jealous of me
Oh, absolutely! You’re talented and you’re good looking
I know! That’s why they trashed me
Whoa. Wait a minute, wait a minute

I, I don’t get you. I mean first, you hate me. Then you sleep with
me. Then you want nothing to do with me, now you want me again
What? So you never went out with an actress before
Kate, do you even like me
Kate, do you even like me
Well so, how come you blew me off? Y'know? How come you were with him

I don’t know! I just, just do this! I-I always have to pick the like
the smartest guy, or-or the most talented guy… Why can’t I just pick someone
like you

You know what I mean. I mean like the sweetest guy. Joey, you’re just
so, you’re so, so… (She passes out and slumps against his shoulder.

(Checks to see if she’s drooling on his shirt.) Okay. Okay, okay,
hey. (Lays her down and covers her with a blanket.) There we go, let’s get your feet
up there. (Looks at her) Good night, Kate. Sweet dreams. (Picks up a garbage can) I’m
gonna put this can right here in case you have to hurl

5.SceneDescription:
Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are sitting on the couch, Rachel is on the
chair.

lines.Line: (bringing Chandler a cup) This is from the woman at the bar

lines.Character:
(He turns and looks at her. The woman whispers something to Gunther; who comes back and
takes the mug away from Chandler
lines.Line:
He turns and looks at her. The woman whispers something to Gunther; who comes back and
takes the mug away from Chandler.
Sorry. She thought you were somebody else
7:15. (Monica looks at him) Watch doesn’t work
Tommy’s supposed to be here soon, we’re going to lunch

Look. Look, I wasn’t going to say anything to you, but... All right,
I don’t think you should be seeing Tommy anymore

No! The guy is mean. I mean really mean. I think you should stay away from
him
Umm, or, maybe, I should stay away from all men

No, it’s not just ‘cause I’m jealous. (Both Monica and
Chandler give him a ‘Come on’ look) I mean I’m not, I’m not, I’m
not jealous, okay? It’s… Look, the guy, he screamed, he actually screamed at
this couple sitting in our seats

Yeah, and at the end of the play, he, he got up y'know, and he just
started like, (claps his hands) banging his hands together

Okay, fine, fine. You don’t want to believe me? No, that’s fine.
(starts to leave

Okay, fine, fine. You don’t want to believe me? No, that’s fine.
(starts to leave
cut to outside of Central Perk

You don’t want to believe me, I’m Mr. Funny to you. Mr.
Funny… (turns around and almost spills his coffee on Tommy)
Ice coffee? Tell me it’s ice coffee

Hot coffee!!! You idiot!! You were gonna spill hot coffee all over me,
huh?!! What are you just some big, dumb, stupid, doofy idiot, with a doofy idiot hairdo,
huh?! Huh?!

lines.Character:
[cut to inside Central Perk, we see Ross quietly tapping on the window, desperately
trying to get the gang’s attention, while Tommy is still screaming at hi
lines.Line:
cut to inside Central Perk, we see Ross quietly tapping on the window, desperately

(not seeing Ross) What’s your favourite thing about summertime
Umm, going to the beach. When it stays light real late
Umm, going to the beach. When it stays light real late

(entering, finished with yelling at Ross, who follows him in shell
shocked) (happily) Hey
Tommyyyy! Say, what’s your favourite thing about summer
Ooh, I don’t know. Probably the smell of freshly cut grass

lines.Character: (Ross is having a fit, about how calm Tommy is no
lines.Line: Ross is having a fit, about how calm Tommy is now

6.SceneDescription:
Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Ross are in the kitchen, Rachel and Monica
are sitting in the living room, and Phoebe is, you guessed it, still on hold.

lines.Line: Hey, mind if I use the phone

Why don’t you use ours across the hall, ‘cause
she…has…problems

(coming out of the kitchen with a cup of coffee, almost running into
Tommy) Oh-ho, whoa! Sorry, Tommy. I almost spilled this hot coffee on you

lines.Character: (We see Tommy go into Joey and Chandler’s apartmen
lines.Line: We see Tommy go into Joey and Chandler’s apartment
Ross, would you just stop it! It’s getting really old
I can’t believe no one believes me
I can’t believe no one believes me

Yeah. But I also believed her (points to the phone) when she said I was
next

lines.Character: [cut to Chandler and Joey’s apartment, Tommy is using the phon
lines.Line: cut to Chandler and Joey’s apartment, Tommy is using the phone

(noticing the chick) Ooh, hey! Hey, there little fella. (picks up the
chick) Mr. Fuzzy-Man, how are you doing? (starts to pet him) Aww. (The chick poops on his
hand.) Eww! Oh! Eww! Gross! Idiot!! Stupid little, fuzzy, yellow creature!! Oh look at me,
I’m so cute, I’m a little chick who’s disgusting! God, you’re so
stupid, how are you not yet extinct!! (the duck wattles behind him and quacks) (to the
duck) Quack-quack, quack-quack!! What are you quacking about?! Dumb Donald Doo-Doo!!

lines.Character: (We see the gang staring at him through the doorways
lines.Line: We see the gang staring at him through the doorways.

lines.Character: (We see the gang staring at him through the doorways
lines.Line: We see the gang staring at him through the doorways.

Ooh, sorry little Mr. Chic-A-Dee, sorry you went doody in my hand!
(starts to walk out and stops) (to Rachel) Well, I guess we’re not going out anymore.
Whaa!!

7.SceneDescription:
Monica and Rachel's, the gang, except Joey, is there. Phoebe is, well you
y'know.

lines.Line: Yeah, I know. Oh, good thing it’s one of those 801 numbers. Right
Phoebe, 800 is toll free, 801 is-is Utah
Phoebe, 800 is toll free, 801 is-is Utah

No, no, no, oh no-no-no, it’s has to be 800. (picks up the
instruction manual to check the phone number) ‘Cause all those big companies have 800
numbers, every one. (Finds the number) Yeah, every big Utah-based company has one
Sorry, I’m so sorry, I will pay you back
And yet, she’s still not hanging up the phone
Hang it up! Hang up the phone!
Hang it up! Hang up the phone!
Fine! Fine! (slams the phone down, breaking it) Oh-oh

Well, I think I broke it. But that’s all right, here’s the
